active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the trade-offs between security and performance when choosing authentication methods for AWS API Gateway (e.g., Lambda custom authorizers vs. IAM sigv4). Consider scenarios like high-traffic APIs and justify your preferred approach with pros/cons.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for university-level cybersecurity education on 'AWS API Gateway Security'. Generate 50 high-quality flashcards optimized for Anki/Quizlet, covering the full topic hierarchy and voter consensus on completeness (e.g., full best practices: IAM/resource policies, Cognito/Lambda authorizers, throttling/usage plans, WAF, TLS encryption, CloudWatch logging). Incorporate: - Learning Objectives: Ensure coverage across all 6 provided objectives (tag each card). - Active Learning: Include 5 cards as 'Activity Prompts' mirroring discussion/peer/problem-solving. - Scaffolding: Distribute cards: 15 Layer 1, 15 Layer 2, 10 Layer 3, 10 Layer 4. - Bloom's Progression: Mix levels for spaced repetition. Use exact Flashcard Schema: Front: Question Back: Answer: ... Explanation: ... (cite AWS docs if possible) Scaffolding Layer: ... Objectives Linked: ... Distractors (if MCQ): ... Vary types: 40% MCQ (with distractors per protocol), 30% Cloze/Delete, 20% Short Answer, 10% Scenario. Ensure active recall, no hints on front. Output as numbered list: --- Card 1 --- Front: ... Back: ... Sources: AWS API Gateway Docs, OWASP API Security, provided research context.
